name: scRNAbox
author: MNI BIOINFO CORE
command-line: scRNAbox_cmd_wrapper.py --R_path $R_PATH --job_mode local <--output_dir DIR> --ref_data_dir "$REF_DATA_DIR"/ <-d DIR> <--method METHOD> <--steps STEPS> <--par_automated_library_prep_scrna> <--par_fastq_directory_scrna DIR> <--par_sample_names_step1 SAMPLE_NAMES> <--par_rename_samples_scrna> <--par_new_sample_names NEW_SAMPLE_NAMES> <--par_paired_end_seq_scrna> <--par_ref_dir_grch_scrna PAR_REF_DIR_GRCH_SCRNA> <--par_r1_length_scrna PAR_R1_LENGTH_SCRNA> <--par_r2_length_scrna PAR_R2_LENGTH_SCRNA>  <--par_include_introns_scrna> <--par_no_target_umi_filter_scrna> <--par_expect_cells_scrna PAR_EXPECT_CELLS_SCRNA> <--par_force_cells_scrna PAR_FORCE_CELLS_SCRNA> <--par_no_bam_scrna> <--par_automated_library_prep_hto> <--par_fastq_directory_hto DIR> <--par_RNA_run_names RNA_RUN_NAMES> <--par_HTO_run_names HTO_RUN_NAMES> <--par_seq_run_names SEQ_RUN_NAMES> <--id ID> <--name NAME> <--read READ> <--pattern PATTERN> <--sequence SEQUENCE> <--par_ref_dir_grch_hto PAR_REF_DIR_GRCH_HTO> <--par_paired_end_seq_hto> <--par_r1_length_hto PAR_R1_LENGTH_HTO> <--par_r2_length_hto PAR_R2_LENGTH_HTO> <--par_include_introns_hto> <--par_no_target_umi_filter_hto> <--par_expect_cells_hto PAR_EXPECT_CELLS_HTO> <--par_force_cells_hto PAR_FORCE_CELLS_HTO> <--par_no_bam_hto>  <--par_save_RNA_step2> <--par_save_metadata_step2> <--par_ambient_RNA> <--par_min_cells_L PAR_MIN_CELLS_L> <--par_normalization_method_step2 PAR_NORMALIZATION_METHOD_STEP2> <--par_scale_factor_step2 PAR_SCALE_FACTOR_STEP2> <--par_selection_method_step2 PAR_SELECTION_METHOD_STEP2> <--par_nfeatures_step2 PAR_NFEATURES_STEP2> <--par_save_RNA_step3> <--par_save_metadata_step3> <--par_seurat_object_step3 DIR> <--par_nFeature_RNA_L PAR_NFEATURE_RNA_L> <--par_nFeature_RNA_U PAR_NFEATURE_RNA_U> <--par_nCount_RNA_L PAR_NCOUNT_RNA_L> <--par_nCount_RNA_U PAR_NCOUNT_RNA_U> <--par_mitochondria_percent_L PAR_MITOCHONDRIA_PERCENT_L> <--par_mitochondria_percent_U PAR_MITOCHONDIA_PERCENT_U> <--par_ribosomal_percent_L PAR_RIBOSOMAL_PERCENT_L> <--par_ribosomal_percent_U PAR_RIBOSOMAL_PERCENT_U> <--par_remove_mitochondrial_genes> <--par_remove_ribosomal_genes> <--par_remove_genes PAR_REMOVE_GENES> <--par_regress_cell_cycle_genes> <--par_regress_custom_genes> <--par_regress_genes PAR_REGRESS_GENES> <--par_normalization_method_step3 PAR_NORMALIZATION_METHOD_STEP3> <--par_scale_factor_step3 PAR_SCALE_FACTOR_STEP3> <--par_selection_method_step3 PAR_SELECTION_METHOD_STEP3> <--par_nfeatures_step3 PAR_NFEATURES_STEP3> <--par_top PAR_TOP> <--par_npcs_pca_step3 PAR_NPCS_PCA_STEP3> <--par_save_RNA_step4_scrna> <--par_save_metadata_step4_scrna> <--par_seurat_object_step4_scrna DIR> <--par_RunUMAP_dims_step4_scrna PAR_RUNUMAP_DIMS_STEP4_SCRNA> <--par_RunUMAP_n_neighbors_step4 PAR_RUNUMAP_N_NEIGHBORS_STEP4> <--par_dropDN_scrna> <--par_PCs PAR_PCS> <--par_pN PAR_PN> <--par_sct> <--par_rate_nExp PAR_RATE_NEXP> <--par_sample_names_step4 PAR_SAMPLE_NAMES_STEP4> <--par_expected_doublet_rate PAR_EXPECTED_DOUBLET_RATE> <--msd> <--par_save_RNA_step4_hto> <--par_save_metadata_step4_hto> <--par_seurat_object_step4_hto DIR> <--par_normalization_method_step4 PAR_NORMALIZATION_METHOD_STEP4> <--par_scale_factor_step4 PAR_SCALE_FACTOR_STEP4> <--par_selection_method_step4 PAR_SELECTION_METHOD_STEP4> <--par_nfeatures_step4 PAR_NFEATURES_STEP4> <--par_dims_umap PAR_DIMS_UMAP> <--par_n_neighbor PAR_N_NEIGHBOR> <--par_dimensionality_reduction> <--par_npcs_pca_step4 PAR_NPCS_PCA_STEP4> <--par_dropDN_hto> <--par_label_dropDN PAR_LABEL_DROPDN> <--par_quantile PAR_QUANTILE> <--par_autoThresh> <--par_maxiter PAR_MAXITER> <--par_RidgePlot_ncol PAR_RIDGEPLOT_NCOL> <--par_old_antibody_label PAR_OLD_ANTIBODY_LABEL> <--par_new_antibody_label PAR_NEW_ANTIBODY_LABEL> <--par_save_RNA_step5> <--par_save_metadata_step5> <--par_seurat_object_step5 DIR> <--par_one_seurat> <--par_integrate_seurat> <--par_merge_seurat> <--par_DefaultAssay PAR_DEFAULTASSAY> <--par_normalization_method_step5 PAR_NORMALIZATION_METHOD_STEP5> <--par_scale_factor_step5 PAR_SCALE_FACTOR_STEP5> <--par_selection_method_step5 PAR_SELECTION_METHOD_STEP5> <--par_nfeatures_step5 PAR_NFEATURES_STEP5> <--par_FindIntegrationAnchors_dim PAR_FINDINTEGRATIONANCHORS_DIM> <--par_RunPCA_npcs PAR_RUNPCA_NPCS> <--par_RunUMAP_dims_step5 PAR_RUNUMAP_DIMS_STEP5> <--par_RunUMAP_n_neighbors_step5 PAR_RUNUMAP_N_NEIGHBORS_STEP5> <--par_compute_jackstraw>  <--par_save_RNA_step6> <--par_save_metadata_step6> <--par_seurat_object_step6 DIR> <--par_skip_integration> <--par_FindNeighbors_dims PAR_FINDNEIGHBORS_DIMS> <--par_RunUMAP_dims_step6 PAR_RUNUMAP_DIMS_STEP6> <--par_FindNeighbors_k_param PAR_FINDNEIGHBORS_K_PARAM> <--par_FindNeighbors_prune_SNN PAR_FINDNEIGHBORS_PRUNE_SNN> <--par_FindClusters_resolution PAR_FINDCLUSTERS_RESOLUTION> <--par_compute_ARI> <--par_RI_reps PAR_RI_REPS> <--markergsea> <--knownmarkers> <--referenceannotation> <--annotate> <--par_save_RNA_step7> <--par_save_metadata_step7> <--par_seurat_object_step7 DIR> <--par_level_cluster PAR_LEVEL_CLUSTER> <--par_run_find_marker> <--par_top_sel PAR_TOP_SEL> <--par_run_enrichR> <--par_db PAR_DB> <--par_run_module_score> <--par_module_score FILE> <--par_run_visualize_markers> <--par_select_features_list PAR_SELECT_FEATURES_LIST> <--par_select_features_csv FILE> <--par_reference FILE> <--par_reference_name PAR_REFERENCE_NAME> <--par_level_celltype PAR_LEVEL_CELLTYPE> <--par_FindTransferAnchors_dim PAR_FINDTRANSFERANCHORS_DIM> <--par_futureglobalsmaxSize PAR_FUTUREGLOBALSMAXSIZE> <--par_annotate_resolution PAR_ANNOTATE_RESOLUTION> <--par_name_metadata PAR_NAME_METADATA> <--par_annotate_labels PAR_ANNOTATE_LABELS> <--addmeta> <--rundge> <--par_save_RNA_step8> <--par_save_metadata_step8> <--par_seurat_object_step8 DIR> <--par_metadata FILE> <--par_merge_meta PAR_MERGE_META> <--par_run_cell_based_all_cells> <--contrast_cell_based_all_cells FILE> <--par_run_cell_based_celltype_groups> <--contrast_cell_based_celltype_groups FILE> <--par_statistical_method PAR_STATISTICAL_METHOD> <--par_run_sample_based_all_cells> <--contrast_sample_based_all_cells FILE> <--par_run_sample_based_celltype_groups> <--contrast_sample_based_celltype_groups FILE>
description: scRNAbox is a collection of tools for single-cell RNA-seq data analysis.

inputs.name: Working directory
inputs.description: Provide nothing to run scRNAbox from step 1. Provide the output of a previous run to continue processing further

inputs.name: Method
inputs.description: Select the appropriate analysis track. For the Standard Track, select (SCRNA). For the HTO Track, select (HTO). The Standard Track is designed for experiments where each sample is captured and sequenced separately, while the HTO Track is designed for multiplexed experiments where samples are tagged with sample-specific oligonucleotide tagged Hashtag antibodies (HTO), pooled, and sequenced together.

inputs.name: Steps
inputs.description: Specify which steps to execute in this run. E.g., 2 will execute Step 2; 2-6 will execute Steps 2 through 6.

inputs.name: Automated library prep
inputs.description: Whether or not to perform automated library prep. Alternatively, you may set this parameter to 'no' and manually prepare the libraries. For most use cases, it is recommended to perform automated library prep.

inputs.name: FASTQ directory
inputs.description: Path to directory containing the FASTQ files for the scRNA-seq experiment. This directory should only contain FASTQ files for the experiment.

inputs.name: Sample names
inputs.description: The sample names used to name the FASTQ files according to CellRanger nomenclature. E.g., if the FASTQ file is named 'PD1_S1_L001_R1_001.fastq', the sample name would be ‘PD1’.

inputs.name: Rename samples
inputs.description: Whether or not you want to rename your samples. These names will be used to identify cells in the Seurat objects.

inputs.name: New sample names
inputs.description: New sample names. Make sure they are defined in the same order as 'par_sample_names'. E.g., you may wish to rename sample 'PD1' to 'Parkinson1'.

inputs.name: Paired-end sequencing
inputs.description: Whether or not paired-end sequencing was performed.

inputs.name: Reference genome
inputs.description: Path to reference genome for FASTQ alignment.

inputs.name: R1 length
inputs.description: Minimum number of bases to retain for R1 sequence of gene expression. For most use-cases, this can be kept at 0 (default).

inputs.name: R2 length
inputs.description: Minimum number of bases to retain for R2 sequence of gene expression. For most use-cases, this can be kept at 0 (default).

inputs.name: Include introns
inputs.description: Whether or not to include intronic reads in the gene expression matrix.

inputs.name: No target UMI filter
inputs.description: Whether or not to turn off CellRanger's target UMI filtering sub-pipeline. For most use-cases, this can remain disabled (default).

inputs.name: Expected cells
inputs.description: Expected number of cells. By default, CellRanger's auto-estimate algorithm will be used. For most use-cases, this can be kept at 0 (default).

inputs.name: Force cells
inputs.description: Force the CellRanger count pipeline to use N cells. For most use-cases, this can be kept at 0 (default).

inputs.name: No bam
inputs.description: Whether or not to skip the bam file generation in the CellRanger pipeline. For most use-cases, this can remain disabled (default).

inputs.name: Automated library prep
inputs.description: Whether or not to perform automated library prep. Alternatively, you may set this parameter to 'no' and manually prepare the libraries. For most use cases, it is recommended to perform automated library prep.

inputs.name: FASTQ directory
inputs.description: Path to directory containing the FASTQ files. This directory should only contain FASTQ files for the experiment.

inputs.name: RNA run names
inputs.description: The names of the sequencing runs for the RNA assay

inputs.name: HTO run names
inputs.description: The names of the sequencing runs for the HTO assay

inputs.name: Sequencing run names
inputs.description: The user-defined name for the sequencing run. These names will be used to identify cells in the Seurat objects.

inputs.name: ID
inputs.description: Barcode ID which will be used to track the feature counts

inputs.name: Name
inputs.description: The user-defined name for the barcode identifier.

inputs.name: Read
inputs.description: Which RNA sequencing read contains the barcode sequence. This value will be either R1 or R2.

inputs.name: Pattern
inputs.description: The pattern of the barcode identifiers

inputs.name: Sequence
inputs.description: The nucleotide sequence for the barcode identifiers.

inputs.name: Reference genome
inputs.description: Path to reference genome for FASTQ alignment.

inputs.name: Paired-end sequencing
inputs.description: Whether or not paired-end sequencing was performed.

inputs.name: R1 length
inputs.description: Minimum number of bases to retain for R1 sequence of gene expression. For most use-cases, this can be kept at 0 (default).

inputs.name: R2 length
inputs.description: Minimum number of bases to retain for R2 sequence of gene expression. For most use-cases, this can be kept at 0 (default).

inputs.name: Include introns
inputs.description: Whether or not to include intronic reads in the gene expression matrix.

inputs.name: No target UMI filter
inputs.description: Whether or not to turn off CellRanger's target UMI filtering sub-pipeline. For most use-cases, this can remain disabled (default).

inputs.name: Expected cells
inputs.description: Expected number of cells. By default, CellRanger's auto-estimate algorithm will be used. For most use-cases, this can be kept at 0 (default).

inputs.name: Force cells
inputs.description: Force the CellRanger count pipeline to use N cells. For most use-cases, this can be kept at 0 (default).

inputs.name: No bam
inputs.description: Whether or not to skip the bam file generation in the CellRanger pipeline. For most use-cases, this can remain disabled (default).

inputs.name: Save RNA expression matrix
inputs.description: Whether or not to export an RNA expression matrix.

inputs.name: Save metadata dataframe
inputs.description: Whether or not to export a metadata dataframe.

inputs.name: Ambient RNA
inputs.description: Whether or not to correct the feature-barcode expression matrices for ambient RNA contamination.

inputs.name: Min Cells L
inputs.description: Only retain genes expressed in a minimum number of cells.

inputs.name: Normalization method
inputs.description: Method to use for normalization (e.g., LogNormalize).

inputs.name: Scale factor
inputs.description: Scale factor

inputs.name: HVG selection method
inputs.description: Method for selecting highly variable genes (e.g., vst).

inputs.name: Number of HVGs
inputs.description: Number of highly variable genes to select (e.g., 2500).

inputs.name: Save RNA expression matrix
inputs.description: Whether or not to export an RNA expression matrix.

inputs.name: Save metadata dataframe
inputs.description: Whether or not to export a metadata dataframe.

inputs.name: Directory containing Seurat object(s)
inputs.description: If you performed Step 2 of the pipeline, keep this parameter empty. Otherwise, if users have an existing Seurat object(s), they may provide the path to a directory that contains the Seurat object(s) to initiate the pipeline at Step 3.

inputs.name: Minimum number of unique RNA transcripts
inputs.description: Only retain cells expressing a minimum number of unique RNA transcripts.

inputs.name: Maximum number of unique RNA transcripts
inputs.description: Only retain cells expressing a maximum number of unique RNA transcripts.

inputs.name: Minimum number of total RNA transcripts
inputs.description: Only retain cells with a minimum number of total RNA transcripts.

inputs.name: Maximum number of total RNA transcripts
inputs.description: Only retain cells with a maximum number of total RNA transcripts.

inputs.name: Minimum mitochondrial RNA percentage
inputs.description: Only retain cells with a minimum percentage of mitochondrial-encoded genes.

inputs.name: Maximum mitochondrial RNA percentage
inputs.description: Only retain cells with a maximum percentage of mitochondrial-encoded genes.

inputs.name: Minimum ribosomal RNA percentage
inputs.description: Only retain cells with a minimum percentage of ribosome genes.

inputs.name: Maximum ribosomal RNA percentage
inputs.description: Only retain cells with a maximum percentage of ribosome genes.

inputs.name: If you want to filter out mitochondrial genes
inputs.description: Whether or not to remove mitochondrial genes.

inputs.name: If you want to filter out ribosomal genes
inputs.description: Whether or not to remove ribosomal genes.

inputs.name: List of genes to remove
inputs.description: If users want to remove specific genes from their data, they may define a list of gene identifiers.

inputs.name: If you want to regress cell cycle genes
inputs.description: Whether or not to regress cell cycle genes.

inputs.name: If you want to regress a custom list of genes
inputs.description: Whether or not to regress a custom list of genes.

inputs.name: List of genes to regress
inputs.description: List of custom genes to regress.

inputs.name: Normalization method
inputs.description: Method to use for normalization (e.g., LogNormalize).

inputs.name: Scale factor
inputs.description: Scale factor for scaling the data (e.g., 10000).

inputs.name: HVG selection method
inputs.description: Method for selecting highly variable genes (e.g., vst).

inputs.name: Number of HVGs
inputs.description: Number of highly variable genes to select (e.g., 2500).

inputs.name: Number of HVGs to be reported
inputs.description: Number of highly variable genes to be reported in the exported csv file (e.g., 100).

inputs.name: Number of principal components
inputs.description: Total number of principal components to compute and store for principal component analysis (e.g., 50).

inputs.name: Save RNA expression matrix
inputs.description: Whether or not to export an RNA expression matrix.

inputs.name: Save metadata dataframe
inputs.description: Whether or not to export a metadata dataframe.

inputs.name: Directory containing Seurat object(s)
inputs.description: If you performed Step 3 of the pipeline, keep this parameter empty. Otherwise, if users have an existing Seurat object(s), they may provide the path to a directory that contains the Seurat object(s) to initiate the pipeline at Step 4.

inputs.name: Number of dimensions to use for UMAP
inputs.description: Number of dimensions to use as input features for uniform manifold approximation and projection (e.g., 25).

inputs.name: Number of neighboring points to use for UMAP
inputs.description: Number of neighboring points used in local approximations of manifold structure (e.g., 45).

inputs.name: Remove predicted doublets from downstream analyses
inputs.description: Whether or not to remove predicted doublets and negatives from downstream analyses.

inputs.name: Number of principal components for doublet detection
inputs.description: Can be informed by the elbow plot produced in Step 3.

inputs.name: The number of artificial doublets
inputs.description: The number of artificial doublets to generate for doublet detection by DoubletFinder (e.g., 0.25). DoubletFinder is largely invariant to this parameter. We suggest keeping 0.25.

inputs.name: SCTransform pre-processing
inputs.description: Whether SCTransform was used while processing the Seurat object. For most use-cases, this parameter can remain deactivated.

inputs.name: Global expected doublet rate
inputs.description: Global expected doublet rate (e.g., for a 5% expected doublet rate, write 0.05). Expected doublet rates can be informed by the number of recovered cells. For more information, see the 10X documentation.

inputs.name: List of sample names
inputs.description: A list of sample names for each sample in the experiment. Sample names should be the same as those defined in --par_rename_samples in Step 1 and must correspond to the sample-specific expected doublet rates defined in the parameter below.

inputs.name: Sample-specific expected doublet rates
inputs.description: A vector of expected doublet rates for each sample (e.g., for a 5% sample-specific expected doublet rate, write 0.05). The expected doublet rates for each sample should be listed in the same order as the sample names in the above parameter. Make sure to have as many expected doublet rates listed as you have samples.

inputs.name: MSD
inputs.description: Before demultiplexing, activate this parameter and leave all other parameters empty to retrieve the barcode labels used in the analysis. If the barcode labels are already known, leave this parameter deactivated and proceed with the remaining parameters.

inputs.name: Save RNA expression matrix
inputs.description: Whether or not to export an RNA expression matrix.

inputs.name: Save metadata dataframe
inputs.description: Whether or not to export a metadata dataframe.

inputs.name: Directory containing Seurat object(s)
inputs.description: If you performed Step 3 of the pipeline, keep this parameter empty. Otherwise, if users have an existing Seurat object(s), they may provide the path to a directory that contains the Seurat object(s) to initiate the pipeline at Step 4.

inputs.name: Normalization method
inputs.description: Method for normalizing the HTO assay (e.g., CLR).

inputs.name: Scale factor
inputs.description: Scale factor for scaling the HTO assay (e.g., 10000).

inputs.name: Highly variable feature selection method
inputs.description: Method for selecting highly variable features in the HTO assay (e.g., vst).

inputs.name: Number of highly variable features
inputs.description: Number of features to select as top variable features for the HTO assay (e.g., 5). This value is dependent on the number of sample specific barcodes used in the experiment.

inputs.name: Number of dimensions to use for UMAP
inputs.description: Number of dimensions to use as input features for uniform manifold approximation and projection of HTO assay (e.g., 5).

inputs.name: Number of neighbouring points to use for UMAP
inputs.description: Number of neighboring points used in local approximations of manifold structure (e.g., 65).

inputs.name: Perform linear dimensional reduction
inputs.description: Whether or not to perform linear dimensionality reduction on the HTO assay.

inputs.name: Number of principal components
inputs.description: The number of principal components to compute and store for principal component analysis of HTO assay (e.g., 30).

inputs.name: Remove predicted doublets from downstream analyses
inputs.description: Whether or not to remove predicted doublets and negatives from downstream analyses.

inputs.name: Labels for filtered cells
inputs.description: Labels used to identify doublet and negative droplets (e.g., Doublet, Negative).

inputs.name: Droplet classification quantile threshold
inputs.description: The quantile to use for droplet classification using MULTIseqDemux (e.g., 0.9).

inputs.name: Automated threshold
inputs.description: Whether or not to perform automated threshold finding to define the best quantile for droplet classification using MULTIseqDemux. For most use cases, this parameter should be activated.

inputs.name: Maximum iteration
inputs.description: Maximum number of iterations to use if --par_autoThresh is activated (e.g., 5).

inputs.name: Ridge plot layout
inputs.description: Number of columns used to display RidgePlots, which visualizes the enrichment of barcode labels across samples (e.g., 3).

inputs.name: Old antibody labels
inputs.description: If you wish to rename the barcode labels, first list the existing barcode labels in this parameter.

inputs.name: New antibody labels
inputs.description: If you wish to rename the barcode labels, list the new labels corresponding to the old labels listed in the parameter above.

inputs.name: Save RNA expression matrix
inputs.description: Whether or not to export an RNA expression matrix.

inputs.name: Save metadata dataframe
inputs.description: Whether or not to export a metadata dataframe.

inputs.name: Directory containing Seurat object(s)
inputs.description: If you performed Step 4 of the pipeline, keep this parameter empty. Otherwise, if users have an existing Seurat object(s), they may provide the path to a directory that contains the Seurat object(s) to initiate the pipeline at Step 5.

inputs.name: Only one sample and skip integration
inputs.description: Whether or not the experiment has only one sample. If this parameter is activated (only one sample), par_integrate_seurat and par_merge_seurat should be deactivated.

inputs.name: Integrate Seurat objects
inputs.description: Whether or not to integrate the samples. If activated, par_merge_seurat must be deactivated.

inputs.name: Merge Seurat objects
inputs.description: Whether or not to merge the samples. If activated, par_integrate_seurat must be deactivated.

inputs.name: Default assay
inputs.description: The assay to perform normalization, scaling, and linear dimensional reduction on (e.g., RNA)

inputs.name: Normalization method
inputs.description: Method to use for normalization (e.g., LogNormalize).

inputs.name: Scale factor
inputs.description: Scale factor for scaling the data (e.g., 10000).

inputs.name: HVG selection method
inputs.description: Method for selecting highly variable genes (e.g., vst).

inputs.name: Number of HVGs
inputs.description: Number of highly variable genes to select (e.g., 2500).

inputs.name: Dimensions for neighbour search space
inputs.description: Which dimensions to use from the canonical correlation analysis (CCA) to specify the neighbor search space (e.g., 25).

inputs.name: Number of principal components
inputs.description: Total number of principal components to compute and store for principal component analysis (e.g., 30).

inputs.name: Number of dimensions to use for UMAP
inputs.description: Number of dimensions to use as input features for uniform manifold approximation and projection (e.g., 25).

inputs.name: Number of neighbouring points to use for UMAP
inputs.description: Number of neighboring points used in local approximations of manifold structure (e.g., 45).

inputs.name: Compute JackStraw
inputs.description: Whether or not to perform JackStraw computation to identify significant principal components.

inputs.name: Save RNA expression matrix
inputs.description: Whether or not to save the RNA expression matrix.

inputs.name: Save metadata dataframe
inputs.description: Whether or not to save the metadata dataframe.

inputs.name: Directory containing Seurat object(s)
inputs.description: If you performed Step 5 of the pipeline, keep this parameter empty. Otherwise, if users have an existing Seurat object(s), they may provide the path to a directory that contains the Seurat object(s) to initiate the pipeline at Step 6.

inputs.name: Skipped integration in step 5
inputs.description: Whether or not the user skipped integration in Step 5.

inputs.name: Number of principal components to find neighbours
inputs.description: Number of principal components used as input to identify neighbours (e.g., 25). Can be informed by the elbow and Jackstraw plots produced in Step 5.

inputs.name: Number of principal components for UMAP
inputs.description: Number of dimensions to use as input features for uniform manifold approximation and projection (e.g., 25).

inputs.name: K-nearest neighbours
inputs.description: Defines k for the k-nearest neighbor algorithm (e.g., 45).

inputs.name: Shared nearest neighbours cut off
inputs.description: Sets the cut off for acceptable Jaccard index when computing the neighborhood overlap for the shared nearest-neighbour construction (e.g., 0.067).

inputs.name: Clustering resolution
inputs.description: Value of the clustering resolution parameter. It is recommended to cluster at various resolutions. (e.g., 0, 0.05, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1.0, 1.25, 1.5, 2.0).

inputs.name: Compute Adjusted Rand Index
inputs.description: Whether or not you want to compute the Adjusted Rand Index (ARI) to evaluate the stability of clusters across user-defined clustering resolutions.

inputs.name: Clustering iterations for Adjusted Rand Index computation
inputs.description: Number of iterations for clustering the data at a given resolution to compute the Adjusted Rand Index (e.g., 25).

inputs.name: Marker GSEA
inputs.description: Identify marker genes for each cluster and GSEA using EnrichR libraries.

inputs.name: Known markers
inputs.description: Profile the individual or aggregated expression of known marker genes.

inputs.name: Reference annotation
inputs.description: Generate annotation predictions based on the annotations of a reference Seurat object.

inputs.name: Add cell type annotations
inputs.description: Add clustering annotations to Seurat object metadata.

inputs.name: If you want to save an RNA expression matrix
inputs.description: If you want to save an RNA expression matrix

inputs.name: Save metadata dataframe
inputs.description: Whether or not to export a metadata dataframe.

inputs.name: Directory containing Seurat object(s)
inputs.description: If you performed Step 6 of the pipeline, keep this parameter empty. Otherwise, if users have an existing Seurat object(s), they may provide the path to a directory that contains the Seurat object(s) to initiate the pipeline at Step 7.

inputs.name: Clustering resolution
inputs.description: The cluster resolution that you want to annotate (e.g., integrated_snn_res.0.75).

inputs.name: Identify cluster-specific markers
inputs.description: Whether or not to identify marker genes for each cluster.

inputs.name: Number of top markers
inputs.description: Number of top markers to display in heatmap based on avg_log2FC (e.g., 5).

inputs.name: Run EnrichR GSEA on cluster-specific markers
inputs.description: Whether or not to run gene set enrichment analysis (GSEA) on the marker genes for each cluster using the EnrichR tools. Note that the HPC must have access to the internet to run GSEA.

inputs.name: EnrichR databases
inputs.description: Character vector of EnrichR databases that define cell types. The top marker genes for each cluster will be tested for enrichment across these databases (e.g., Descartes_Cell_Types_and_Tissue_2021, CellMarker_Augmented_2021, Azimuth_Cell_Types_2021).

inputs.name: Compute module score
inputs.description: Path to the csv file containing the gene sets for the module score (see ScRNAbox documentation for an example .csv file).

inputs.name: Gene sets for module score
inputs.description: csv file containing the genes sets for module score

inputs.name: Visualize known markers
inputs.description: Whether or not to visualize the individual expression of known marker genes.

inputs.name: List of known markers to visualize
inputs.description: List of marker genes whose expression will be visualized individually.

inputs.name: CSV file containing known markers to visualize
inputs.description: To define multiple feature lists for individual visualization, provide the path to a CSV file where each column represents a list. The column names should describe the list names, and all features belonging to the same list should be placed in the corresponding column.

inputs.name: Reference Seurat RDS object
inputs.description: Path to the reference Seurat object.

inputs.name: Name of reference object
inputs.description: The name of the metadata column in the reference Seurat object that defines cell type labels to be transferred to the query object (e.g., Cell_Type).

inputs.name: Metadata column in the reference Seurat object containing cell type annotations
inputs.description: Name of a metadata column in the reference Seurat object that contains cell type annotations

inputs.name: Number of dimensions for reference-based annotation
inputs.description: Number of dimensions used to find transfer anchors between the reference and query Seurat objects (e.g., 50).

inputs.name: Maximum allowed size of global objects
inputs.description: The maximum allowed size of global objects that can be exported to parallel workers (e.g., 62914560000). This will increase your RAM usage so set this number mindfully.

inputs.name: Clustering resolution to annotate
inputs.description: Which clustering resolution to annotate (e.g., integrated_snn_res.0.75).

inputs.name: Metadata slot for storing cluster labels
inputs.description: The name of the metadata slot that will contain the annotations (e.g., Cell_Types1).

inputs.name: A list of cluster labels
inputs.description: A list of cluster labels, with one label per cluster at the specified clustering resolution. Avoid using underscores '_' in the labels.

inputs.name: Add metadata
inputs.description: Add metadata information to the Seurat object to facilitate DGE contrasts.

inputs.name: Run DGE
inputs.description: Perform DGE contrasts.

inputs.name: Save RNA expression matrix
inputs.description: Whether or not to export an RNA expression matrix.

inputs.name: Save metadata dataframe
inputs.description: Whether or not to export a metadata dataframe.

inputs.name: Directory containing Seurat object(s)
inputs.description: If you performed Step 7 of the pipeline, keep this parameter empty. Otherwise, if users have existing Seurat object(s), they may provide the path to a directory that contains the Seurat object(s) to initiate the pipeline at Step 8.

inputs.name: New metadata
inputs.description: Path to the csv file containing the new metadata to be added to the Seurat object.

inputs.name: Seurat column to merge new metadata
inputs.description: The column from the Seurat metadata that will be used to merge the new metadata (e.g., orig.ident). This column must also exist in the csv file containing new metadata defined in the above parameter.

inputs.name: Perform cell-based DGE with all cells
inputs.description: Whether or not to compute cell-based DGE across all cell types together.

inputs.name: Contrast matrix for cell-based DGE with all cells
inputs.description: Path to the contrast matrix for cell-based DGE with all cells. For an example contrast matrix see the scRNAbox documentation (https://neurobioinfo.github.io/scrnabox/site/Step8/).

inputs.name: Perform cell-based DGE with cell type groups
inputs.description: Whether or not to compute cell-based DGE within each cell type group independently.

inputs.name: Contrast matrix for cell-based DGE with cell type groups
inputs.description: Path to the contrast matrix for cell-based DGE with cell type groups. For an example contrast matrix see the scRNAbox documentation (https://neurobioinfo.github.io/scrnabox/site/Step8/).

inputs.name: Statistical method for cell-based DGE
inputs.description: Which statistical framework to use for computing cell-based DGE (e.g., MAST).

inputs.name: Perform sample-based DGE with all cells
inputs.description: Whether or not to compute cell-based DGE across all cell types together.

inputs.name: Contrast matrix for sample-based DGE with all cells
inputs.description: Path to the contrast matrix for sample-based DGE with all cells. For an example contrast matrix see the scRNAbox documentation (https://neurobioinfo.github.io/scrnabox/site/Step8/).

inputs.name: Perform sample-based DGE with cell type groups.
inputs.description: Whether or not to compute sample-based DGE within each cell type group independently.

inputs.name: Contrast matrix for sample-based DGE with cell type groups
inputs.description: Path to the contrast matrix for sample-based DGE with cell type groups. For an example contrast matrix see the scRNAbox documentation (https://neurobioinfo.github.io/scrnabox/site/Step8/).

groups.name: Step 1 SCRNA Track: FASTQ to expression matrix
Step 2: Create Seurat object and remove ambient RNA
Step 7: Cell type annotation
groups.description:
Step 7 parameters
 Note: ScRNAbox provides three methods for cell type annotation, as well as an option to add cell type annotations to the Seurat object’s metadata:

(1) Marker Gene Set Enrichment Analysis (GSEA),
(2) Known Markers,
(3) Reference-Based Annotation,
(4) Add Cell Type Annotations.Each method has its own set of parameters as described below.

Only the parameters relevant to the method currently being run need to be defined.
In addition to the method-specific parameters, there are general parameters that must be defined for each run, regardless of the method being used.

groups.name: Step 7 Add cell type annotations parameters
Step 8: Differential gene expression analysis
groups.description:
Step 8 parameters

Note: Step 8 comprises two distinct components:

(1) Add metadata
(2) Run differential gene expression (DGE) analysis

Add metadata allows users to add meta data containing phenotypic and experimental information to the Seurat object, which can then be used to define the groups used for DGE analysis. Run DGE analysis computes DGE between conditions. ScRNAbox provides options to compute DGE across all cell types together or individual cell types independently. Additionally, scRNAbox can compute cell-based or sample-based (pseudobulk) DGE.

groups.name: Step 8 general parameters
groups.description:
Each component has its own set of parameters as described below.

Only the parameters relevant to the component currently being run need to be defined.
In addition to the component-specific parameters, there are general parameters that must be defined for each run, regardless of the component being run.
